com.henrikhedberg.ohap

Class IncomingMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.henrikhedberg.ohap.IncomingMessage

  • public class IncomingMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses an incoming OHAP message.

    Call either readFrom(InputStream) or readFromNB(InputStream) to read a message from an InputStream or @{link #readFrom(ByteBuffer) to read a message from a ByteBuffer. Then, use integer8(), integer16(), integer32(), decimal64(), allBytes(byte[]), binary8(), and text() sequentially to take parsed values.

    Version:
    1.1 (20160320)
    Author:
    Henrik Hedberg <henrik.hedberg@iki.fi>

      IncomingMessage()

      Takes the next IEEE 754 floating-point double precision decimal number from the message.

      Takes the next unsigned 16-bit integer from the message.

      Takes the next unsigned 32-bit integer from the message.

      Tries to read one message from the given ByteBuffer.
      boolean readFromNB(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
      Tries to read one message from the given InputStream.
      java.lang.String text()
      Treats the next bytes as text and takes it from the message.

    • Method Detail

      • readFrom

        public void readFrom(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Reads one message from the given InputStream. Blocks until the message is fully read.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - the stream to read from
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an operation on the given stream throws an exception

      • readFromNB

        public boolean readFromNB(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to read one message from the given InputStream. If the message is fully read, returns true. If the message is not fully available yet, does not block but returns false. In that case, the message may be partially read from the stream.

        Relies on the InputStream.available() to work.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - the stream to read from
        Returns:
        whether the message was fully read
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an operation on the given stream throws an exception

      • readFromNB

        public boolean readFromNB(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Tries to read one message from the given ByteBuffer. If the message is fully read, returns true. If the message is not fully available yet, does not block but returns false. In that case, the message may be partially taken from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - the buffer to read from
        Returns:
        whether the message was fully read

      • integer8

        public int integer8()
        Takes the next unsigned 8-bit integer from the message.
        Returns:
        unsigned 8-bit number
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if there are not enough bytes left
